page.title: 07Waltham St Lawrence School
page.content:
{Waltham St Lawrence School}is situated in the hamlet of{West End } which is midway between the villages of Waltham St Lawrence and Shurlock Row. The school was built in 1910 and this year the school has celebrated its 75th Anniversary and started to use the school bell on the roof again.
There are 60 children, two teachers and a headmaster in the school. There are two classes - one of infants and one of juniors. The school has an outdoor learner{swimming pool}, a large{playing field}with a football pitch, a{playground}and a{canteen}. We are making part of the school into a{Nature Reserve}, we have a{pond}, a {ditch}, a{marsh}, a{wild flower garden a{hedge}and some{copses}. The school does a lot of work involving the use of{computers}and{technology}.
